marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump to nominate Scott Bessent as Treasury Secretary
marketNews.content: The elected President of the United States, Donald Trump, said on Friday (22/11) that he will nominate Scott Bessent as the U.S. Treasury Secretary. Bessent spent his career in finance, having worked for George Soros and Jim Chanos before running his own hedge fund. Reuters reported that Bessent is a supporter of tax reform and deregulation, and some analysts see his appointment as potentially reducing the likelihood of high import tariffs as advocated by Trump.

marketNews.title: Indonesia tax amnesty 3 will be similar to previous rounds, concerns about shadow economy
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the third tax amnesty will not differ much from the previous amnesties in 2016-2017 and 2022. A parliamentary source said the third amnesty will target shadow economy activities, both legal and illegal, that are not reported for tax. However, a tax analyst from the Center for Indonesia Taxation Analysis, Fajry Akbar, doubts that shadow economy participants will join the amnesty. He urges the government and parliament to abandon the amnesty plan because it could create moral hazard and damage the government's image and credibility.

marketNews.title: Indonesian government removes BPHTB and PBG for low-income households
marketNews.content: The government officially removed the land and building acquisition duty (BPHTB) and building permit approval (PBG) for low-income households on Monday (25/11). The policy aims to lower house prices and accelerate the realization of the program to build three million houses per year.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange considers higher IPO proceeds criteria for listings
marketNews.content: The CEO of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, Iman Rachman, said that the exchange is considering a minimum IPO proceeds requirement as part of a reform of listing rules. The exchange has started encouraging companies with equity over IDR 2 trillion to ensure that IPO proceeds are at least 10% of the company's total valuation, instead of the current minimum 10% free float. The proposal is being discussed with OJK and may be approved in early 2025. The move follows FTSE Russell's removal of Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) from its index in September 2024 due to high shareholder concentration.

marketNews.title: Satgas Penurunan Harga Tiket Pesawat plans three new incentives for the holiday season
marketNews.content: The Task Force for Reducing Air Ticket Prices is planning three new incentives to lower ticket prices during the Christmas and New Year period: 1) reduce the fuel surcharge for jet aircraft from 10% to 2% from 19 December 2024 to 3 January 2025; 2) reduce the fuel surcharge for propeller aircraft from 25% to 20% in the same period; and 3) keep avtur prices unchanged during December 2024 or provide a discount of 7.5%-10%. These incentives are added to an existing 50% reduction in airport service fees for the same dates. The task force expects ticket prices to drop by 10%-13% during the holiday season.

marketNews.title: Rich countries commit to $300 billion per year climate finance at COP29
marketNews.content: Wealthy nations on Sunday (24/11) pledged to mobilize at least US$300 billion per year for climate financing in developing countries, according to the agreement reached at the United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP29). This amount is higher than the current commitment of US$100 billion per year, which ends in 2025, but still far below the developing countries' demand of US$1.3 trillion per year by 2035.

tickerNews.title: BBRI 10M24: Net profit +5.3% YoY
tickerNews.content:
Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded net profit (bank only) of IDR 4.1 trillion (down 8.2% YoY, down 26% MoM) in October 2024, resulting in a net profit (bank only) for the first ten months of 2024 of IDR 45.7 trillion (+5.3% YoY). Negative aspects: Credit Cost (CoC) rose again and Net Interest Margin (NIM) fell. Positive aspects: operating expense (opex) remained controlled.

CoC rose again: after a two-month improvement, BBRI's bank-only CoC in October 2024 increased to 3.15% (+131 bps YoY, +38 bps MoM), still below the May and July 2024 peak of 3.8-3.9%. This pushed the CoC for the first ten months of 2024 to 3.19% (vs. 2.57% in the same period 2023), worse than the FY24 management guidance that targets a maximum of 3%. The CoC increase was driven by a rise in provision expenses in October 2024 to IDR 3.2 trillion (+83% YoY, +15% MoM), bringing total provisions for the first ten months to IDR 31.6 trillion (+36% YoY). The higher provisions pressured monthly net profit, although the Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) (bank only) remained at IDR 8.5 trillion (+19% YoY, -11% MoM).

NIM weakened: BBRI's bank-only NIM fell to 6.28% (-12 bps YoY, -20 bps MoM) in October 2024 after a prior upward trend. This resulted in a ten-month NIM of 6.34% (vs. 6.73% in the same period 2023). The decline was due to a shift in asset mix toward lower-yielding assets, with deposits at Bank Indonesia rising +17% YoY while holdings of securities (including government bonds) fell -8.6% YoY.

Efficiency maintained: BBRI kept operational efficiency by reducing opex to IDR 5.4 trillion (-2.8% YoY, +19% MoM) in October 2024, driven by lower labor costs. Over the first ten months, opex grew only +4.4% YoY to IDR 48.6 trillion, supporting a PPOP increase of +15% YoY to IDR 89.5 trillion.

Key Takeaway: Although CoC rose in October 2024, we remain wait-and-see to determine whether this is caused by a front-loading effect that will normalize by year-end, or signals deteriorating asset quality. Market concerns also focus on the performance of BBRI's subsidiary PT Permodalan Nasional Madani, which is not reflected in the bank-only results.

tickerNews.title: DOID purchases 51% stake in Dawson Complex coking coal mine for US$455 million
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur, through its subsidiary PT Bukit Makmur Internasional (BUMA International), signed an agreement to purchase 51% of the coking coal mining asset Dawson Complex from Peabody Energy Corporation for US$455 million. Dawson Complex is one of the largest metallurgical coal assets in Australia, with a resource life of more than 50 years. The transaction is part of the divestiture of remaining metallurgical coal assets owned by Anglo American to Peabody Energy, after which Peabody will transfer Dawson Complex to BUMA International in a back-to-back transaction.

tickerNews.title: MDIY plans IPO of 2.5 billion shares to raise up to IDR 4.7 trillion
tickerNews.content: Operator MR.D.I.Y, Daya Intiguna Yasa (MDIY), plans to conduct an IPO of 2.5 billion shares (10% of equity) at an offering price of approximately IDR 1,650-1,870 per share, targeting proceeds of IDR 4.2-4.7 trillion. The funds will be used 60% for debt repayment, 30% for opening new stores of its subsidiary, and 10% for working capital. About 2.3 billion shares (9%) will be held by the controlling shareholder, Azara Alpina Sdn. Bhd., with the remainder being new shares. The public offering is scheduled for 13-17 December 2024, with listing on 19 December 2024. In the first half of 2024, MDIY reported net profit of IDR 532 billion (+228% YoY), revenue of IDR 3.2 trillion (+93% YoY), and same-store sales growth of +11% YoY. The total number of stores reached 824 (+41% YoY), with 60% of stores located outside Java.

tickerNews.title: ADRO announces cum-date for shareholder offering of AADI on 26 November 2024
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) announced that the expected cum-date for the shareholder offering of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) is 26 November 2024, with the exercise period for shareholders scheduled for 6-10 December 2024. The electronic distribution of shares is expected on 9-11 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: PGAS reports 10M24 gas sales volume 853 BBtud, down 8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) recorded gas sales volume of 853 BBtud (down 8% YoY) during the first ten months of 2024, 11% below the 2024 management target. Of this volume, 54% was contributed by users of the specific gas price (HGBT), with the remainder from non-HGBT users. Gas transmission volume reached 1,529 MMSCFD (+5% YoY), 1% above the 2024 target. LNG sales volume was 62 BBtud (+100% YoY), 51% below the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: ENRG renegotiates oil and gas contracts, raising price at Sengkang block
tickerNews.content: The Deputy President Director of Energi Mega Persada (ENRG), Eduardus Ardianto, said the company has renegotiated several oil and gas contracts with its customers, resulting in a higher selling price at the Sengkang block from US$5.08 per BBtud to US$6 per BBtud, with sales volume also increasing though details were not disclosed. A renegotiated contract for the Bentu block raised the price from 10% of the Indonesia Crude Price (ICP) to 10.75% of ICP.

tickerNews.title: ERAL acquires 51% of JD Sports Indonesia subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) announced that it has signed a purchase agreement for 51% of PT JDSports Fashion Indonesia (JDFI) and 49% of PT JDSports Fashion Distribution (JDFD) from JD Sports Fashion Plc. The transaction value was not disclosed. After the deal, ERAL's ownership in JDFI and JDFD rises to 99.9%, and the subsidiaries will be consolidated into ERAL's financial statements.

tickerNews.title: LEAD targets US$2.4 million net profit FY24 and plans private placement
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of Logindo Samudramakmur, Denny Haryanto, said the company targets a net profit of US$2.4 million for FY24, reversing a net loss of US$5.4 million in FY23. He noted that charter vessel demand and the rupiah-dollar exchange rate will affect FY24 net profit, as part of the charter revenue is in rupiah. LEAD also obtained shareholder approval to conduct a private placement of IDR 325.5 billion at the end of November 2024 to convert debt into equity.

tickerNews.title: KETR clarifies no corporate actions planned for the next three months
tickerNews.content: Ketrosden Triasmitra stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company's main shareholders are looking for potential investors with positive synergies, but KETR has no plans to undertake any corporate actions for at least the next three months.

tickerNews.title: WIFI injects capital of IDR 53.4 billion into subsidiary DSS
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI) announced that it has injected capital of IDR 53.4 billion into its subsidiary PT Dharma Sinar Semesta (DSS), which operates in the fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) business.

tickerNews.title: ABMM acquires 99.9% of CTBN, SCN and CPPI subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama (ABMM), through its subsidiary PT Cipta Krida Bahari (CKB), announced that it has signed purchase agreements for 99.9% of the shares in two CTBN subsidiaries, PT Citra Tubindo (CTBN), PT Sarana Citranusa Kabil (SCN) and PT Citra Pembina Pengangkutan Industries (CPPI). The transaction value was not disclosed. The deal aims to develop ABMM's logistics business.

tickerNews.title: PPRI director Dilon Sutandar sells 30 million shares at average price IDR 116.3
tickerNews.content: Director of Paperocks Indonesia (PPRI), Dilon Sutandar, sold 30 million PPRI shares at an average price of IDR 116.3 per share on 21 November 2024. The total transaction value was approximately IDR 3.5 billion. After the sale, Dilon's ownership in PPRI decreased from 24.65% to 21.86%.
